alert.note: Alert for Summit (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 3:16PM MDT until August 11 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dry wash and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected within the Chalk Creek watershed and road. * WHERE...A portion of northern Utah, including the following county, Summit. * WHEN...Until 515 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Some low-water crossings may become impassable along Chalk Creek Road from side drainage washouts. Debris on the road is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 314 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause dry wash and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coalville and Hoytsville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
